text: When I notice myself carrying most of the emotional labor, I recognize it and choose to share it more equally instead.
During moments when I avoid emotional labor, I notice it and choose to step up and share the weight instead.
When I feel the pull to take on all emotional work, I notice it and choose to balance it with my partner instead.
I let carrying the relationship or avoiding emotional labor prevent me from sharing it equally with my partner.
When I notice emotional labor imbalance, I recognize it and choose to address it and find balance instead.
I see when I'm doing too much or too little emotional work, and I choose to adjust the balance accordingly.
When I feel the urge to let my partner handle all emotional labor, I notice it and choose to share it instead.
I let not identifying emotional labor patterns prevent me from sharing it equally and balancing the relationship.
When I notice balanced emotional labor, I recognize it and choose to maintain that equal sharing.
I recognize when emotional labor imbalance comes from old patterns rather than present needs, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the pull to let emotional labor become one-sided, I notice it and choose to restore balance instead.
I let problems from emotional labor imbalance prevent me from identifying and sharing it equally with my partner.
When I notice myself taking on too much emotional work, I recognize it and choose to set boundaries instead.
I see when emotional labor is shared well, and I choose to recognize and maintain that balance.
When I feel the urge to avoid addressing emotional labor imbalance, I notice it and choose to face it directly instead.
I let carrying or avoiding emotional labor prevent me from identifying and balancing it equally in relationships.
When I notice healthy emotional labor patterns, I recognize them and choose to strengthen those habits.
I recognize when emotional labor needs adjustment, and I choose to work together to share it more equally.
When I feel the pull to let emotional labor become unbalanced, I notice it and choose to restore equality instead.
I let not identifying whether I'm carrying or avoiding emotional labor prevent me from sharing it equally.
